website_summaries.verdict: The computer processor to choose when you want a small upgrade in performance for general computer use.
pros: Good value with a decent boost in speed and performance
Some purchase options include compatible motherboards if a total CPU and motherboard replacement is necessary

website_summaries.verdict: As long as unmatched 1080p gaming isn't the main objective for your build, it's hard to beat the high clock speeds, thread and core count, and overall performance of AMD's Ryzen 5 1600X CPU for the price.
pros: Great price for a six-core, 12-thread chip
Beats even the pricier Core i7-7700K when using all cores on some tests
cons: Lags behind the equivalent Intel chips for 1080p gaming

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is... Amazing. I upgraded from the amd fx 4350 and all i can say is wow! Most people would think a CPU upgrade wouldnt improve gameplay that much whatsoever, but my gaming experience has dramatically increased, especially on cpu heavy titles like planetside 2. Games run better, editing tools/software development tools run better, the internet is faster for some reason(idk why, prob has nothin to do with my cpu lol). Basically, if you have the budget, go for this here cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Davenport

customer_reviews.title: AMD All the Way! Great for everything, for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing CPU with tons of power for games and multi-threaded processing. Has great overclocking potential. I did a minor OC with a basic cooler and it did 4GHz over all cores, easy. I posted a picture of my UserBenchmark score here. If you have a better cooler, it can do so much more! I have owned many CPUs from Intel and AMD. My last CPU was an Intel, but ever since AMD came out with the Ryzen line of CPUs, I wanted one. Now that I own one, I can honestly say, these CPUs are BEASTS! Good job AMD! I would definitely recommend AMD over Intel now. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Dart Wolf Paws

customer_reviews.title: Way to go AMD!
customer_reviews.text: I have an AMD Ryzen 1800X as well, this baby rocks as well. Look at the specs and this is essentially an 1800X with two cores less. There are even some reports of 1600x's with all 8 cores running. This is and the regular 1600 are by far the best abng for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Repro63

customer_reviews.title: Reliable CPU that doesn’t need overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my Ryzen 1600X. Reliable and fast. I game with an RX 570 8gb and this cpu. Installed on an Asus B350F Strix motherboard. Runs cool. Haven’t overclocked yet because the cores push that boost speed well enough for anything. Paired with a Hyper 212 to cool. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Deelybop

customer_reviews.title: Installed on a MSI x370 motherboard, clocked at 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a MSI x370 motherboard, clocked at 4 GHz at 1.375 volts running stable. Handbrake renders that took my old AMD Athlon ii X2 260 three hours to complete now finish in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: The Admiral JT

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast, with a basic cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast, with a basic cheap cooler I'm able to tax is fairly heavily without it getting too hot, and it just absolutes eats any task I throw at it without breaking a sweat. I've been running heavy rendering on it that took hours on my previous system that takes minutes on this thing, if that!
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Really good processor for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Really good processor for the money. You would have to be a really serious hard core gamer to need more....Maybe if you ran SEITI's program in the background too... Make sure that you get plenty of cooling so it does not reduce it's clock speed to compensate for overheating and get a mainboard that allows overclocking if you want it. Don't forget that it has no support for onboard graphics so you need a card to start.
customer_reviews.author: R. Siegfried

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic CPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was defective. All cores were working, but each of them would be running at a random frequency. It wasn't able to boost, and it was scoring well under what it should have been in the benchmarks. The second one I received has been working great for nearly a year now. Fantastic CPU for gaming, rendering, and streaming. Beats my friends i7-7700k in many benchmarks and some games that utilize multiple cores.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect for gamers and light content creators on a budget
customer_reviews.text: This is more than enough power for the average gamer/light content creator (streamers and such), 6 cores and 12 logical threads, it can shred just about every task most people with home desktops can throw at it, obviously, if you want overkill or are running some serious rendering software or go for a threadripper or an OC'd Ryzen 7. But honestly, this is perfect for gamers and light content creators on a budget, I can't recommend it enough. Pair it with a good tower cooler and you'll be good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Marty R.

customer_reviews.title: I would order again
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get the product earlier than expected. I already was able to get my new pc built and started playing on it last night. So far everything is great. I know some people have complained about their processors coming with bent pins (not from here specifically but in general). I made sure I checked mine when it arrived and all looked good and in pristine shape. I would order from here again.
customer_reviews.author: shopbuddy_twinkle

customer_reviews.title: Disable CPB and/or Cool N Quiet and set Windows power profile to performance for overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Thee best budget cpu for gaming. Do your research and learn what you are buying before the purchase. It seems a few people did not and are leaving bad reviews because they didn't know this cpu doesn't come with a cooler. Also, check the qvl on your motherboard for compatible ram. Some said they couldn't get the ram speed to 3k or higher, but there are vendors who make specific ram that can. Team Group, G.Skill and Corsair, for example. Again, do your research, check the qvl's, and I guarantee you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BlackJack

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-threaded and Single Core Performer.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best sweet-spot processor for gaming, with one of the highest single core out of box clock and plenty of space for overclocking, I think this is the right choice for enthusiast level gaming on the AMD side of the spectrum, it also has some of the best Multi-threaded performance especially at mid-tier processing.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU for the money
customer_reviews.text: Finally upgraded my 9 year old PC with a new motherboard, this CPU and RAM. Going from 2 cores @ 3.0MHz to 6 cores @ 3.6MHz. It lets me play Cities Skylines without jerkyness due to insufficient processing power. It can be overclocked but I do not need the extra performance. Been running for 2-3 weeks now. (Be advised Windows 10 Has some hoops to jump through BEFORE you change your motherboard unless you intend to purchase new software. Check Youtube)
customer_reviews.author: Bills72SJ

customer_reviews.title: love these ryzen chips!
customer_reviews.text: So much value for the money! multitasking, gaming and usage in general are all a breeze for this chip for what I do on my machine. I would give 5 stars but I have not quite tested the stability because I have a low power-psu, only a bronze rated 450w while my rig recommends a 550w, so I do not want to push this card too hard and short circuit the entire machine.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Arrieta

customer_reviews.title: Great chip
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an Fx-8320. Paired with 16gb of FlareX 3200 ddr4, and Msi B350 gaming pro carbon, this thing screams. Using a Noctua NH-U12S SE am4 air cooler, it stays below 63 C when overclocked to 4.1Ghz on all cores (at 1.38v). My basement is a steady 60 F though, which helps. I have it running at 4.05Ghz for everyday use. I knew it had no fan included, so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU and probably the most you would need for gaming!!
customer_reviews.text: Has worked perfectly for me and is NOTICEABLY faster that my Fx6300 (Overclocked to 4.6ghz).. I have not over clocked this cpu yet so I cant speak to that.. But it handles all the website, graphics design, 10+ browsers open, and other business related software that I often have running simultaneously. I used a Noctua Air NH-l9 cooler.. perfect combo if you dont plan on overclocking to much.. Cinebench CPU score hits at 1213... Plan on buying another one of these for the gaming rig when I upgrade the internals. Will definitely overclock that one as far as I can and report back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: The price seemed high for what I was getting but was not disappointed, worked amazing when rendering footage on premiere, I got used to slow macs.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Like a Little Rocket!
customer_reviews.text: For only $158.00 I was quite impressed with its desktop speed. I upgraded my wife's Cyberpowerpc (Ryzen 5 1400) with this chip; and installed a Deepcool 120 AIO. The difference in processing time vs. the 1400 is like night and day. My wife isn't a gamer, other than Hoyle Card Games and PC Monopoly, but I, as long term Intel builder, am very taken with this little chip's behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Shields

customer_reviews.title: This is a great upgrade for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upgrade for the price. You can overclock it, but you won't get that much of an increase in performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install no bios update needed(asrock b350 pro) (it’s not rocket science!) and my wife says it runs so much faster than her old FX 6300 cpu.
customer_reviews.author: boomer559

customer_reviews.title: This CPU is great. Fast as lighting and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is great. Fast as lighting and affordable. My old rig used a FX 6300, and I was planning on going intel till I heard about Ryzen and decided to wait for it, and I am sure glad I did. Runs stable at 3.9ghz and smashes all my games.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent CPU for the price, upgraded from the 1500x which was a no brainer for the price. Temps idle from 35-40 and during heavy gaming usually go from 45-60 max with an all in one water cooler. Couldn’t be happier with this processor. Works great for my amd build and meets the requirements for the latest and greatest games.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this CPU, I've been using only AMD CPUs since the Athlon era. I have had also socket 462, AM2, AM3, FM2, AM1 CPUs and a couple of laptops. I'm really happy they were able to deliver this time. The 12 threads are a blessing when compiling under Linux, and also while using video encoding software such as x265 and x264.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Shipping in the same box that the non-X variant ships ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipping in the same box that the non-X variant ships in is overkill since this doesn't come with a heatsink. Would've preferred to see it ship in a much smaller box, I'm sure Amazon would've preferred so as well. Installation was a breeze and it worked perfectly from the very first boot. Other thoughts: I wish the AMD Ryzen Power Profile would install automatically via Windows Updates without needing to manually download and install the AMD Chipset Drivers from AMD's website.
customer_reviews.author: RedOneStandingBy

customer_reviews.title: Better than compared overprice Intel processor
customer_reviews.text: Better than compared overprice Intel processor, purchased to built a gaming computer for my son. He is amazed with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: ez2deal

customer_reviews.title: 8 Ghz and since I wanted to water cool it the lack of a fan coming with it ...
customer_reviews.text: You seriously can't go wrong with this CPU. It's an incredible value for the price. Mine is OC'd to 3.8 Ghz and since I wanted to water cool it the lack of a fan coming with it didn't bug me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I'd say this was well worth what I received. I replaced my old FX-8350 with this processor and kept my old Corsair Hydro Series H60 Liquid Cooling System with a standard 120mm fan. I also purchased the ASUS ROG Crosshair VI Hero so I could reuse my liquid cooling because it has the holes to mount any AM3+ CPU cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Overclocks well, really speedy, good value for the money, get a B350 mobo or higher for the best overclocking capability.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over the regular 1600 because this one would be almost guaranteed to overclock better and I was right. This overclocks to 4ghz at 1.325v, obviously yours may be different, but this is my success story. Not sure if my applications read the temp wrong but it idles at 40-50C, with a Cryorig H7, but at it has never hit above 70C even while doing heavy bench-marking and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Ranney

customer_reviews.title: wonderful chip
customer_reviews.text: ryzen is no joke, i'd recommend ryzen to just about anybody and ryzen 5 1600x is great for a $1,600.00 build
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Handles everything I throw at it like a champ, if you are really on a budget its a solid buy even today, however you should go for a Ryzen 3000 series
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMD that is all that is
customer_reviews.text: Was used in a customer build. Easy to install and get up and running. Has not had any issues running the newest games.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best ryzen 5 processor
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST ryzen 5 processor. This one is hard to find, they clocked the new ones down a bit. THis is a year older than the new ryzens. This is the one you want. Performs better than my FX 8350! Feels like an intel i5
customer_reviews.author: A.Mallah

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded from a AMD 8350 to the 1600x. Well worth the money and the difference is amazing. I was glad with my purchase and haven't ran into any problems besides the original startup. With AMD your PC needs to be up to date or crashes are warranted. But after the frustrating task of updating in-between BSODs it hasn't had any problems and runs extremely smooth with my current setup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zaio

customer_reviews.title: Really good value
customer_reviews.text: 6 core processor with hyper threading and a good clock speed. It's been solid for me for over a year and has been great for playing video games, editing videos and pictures and anything that I throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a money saver
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent processor. But its kind of out dated. It also doesn't come with a cooler of any sort so plan on buying one of those, which for me killed the little bit of savings I got from not buying a newer model like the 2600.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Great value(@70USD)
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great value for a processor. Overclocked well and for the price I don't think you could find anything to beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Allen

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal power for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this processor. Built my first computer using the Ryzen 5 1600x and it has worked flawlessly so far. Mostly use the computer for music production and gaming and I can't seem to get the processor to even break a sweat. The amount of power you get for the money is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMD is back!
customer_reviews.text: AMD put Intel on notice with this baby, its got everything you could want in a CPU. Its fast, it doesn't guzzle power even when overclocked, and of course it overclocks exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: Sevorast

customer_reviews.title: Comes without a HS fan :/????
customer_reviews.text: Well to know this item is the AMD 1600X and does work the only big problem is how am i going to get this processor to work when theres no fan? First off you know how dangerous that is. Second i can get a whole new one for the same price but only have it come with a fan its very bad and not professional to do this.
customer_reviews.author: FJO

customer_reviews.title: A nice upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice upgrade from the FX series. I did unfortunately have to downgrade from a 8 core, but no issues yet, runs smooth as butter.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Nice CPU
customer_reviews.text: I currently have this in my PC and it runs great. It's not the best one you can get for gaming but for the price it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Was able to test it a bit before i gave it to him and i almost liked it more than my 1800x
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a build i made for my dad, Was able to test it a bit before i gave it to him and i almost liked it more than my 1800x. Great processor for the price, might even pick up one for a secondary rig they're just that good.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great low power 12 core!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Vast improvement over my FX 8350 when using photoshop and substance designer.
customer_reviews.author: UrKungFuNoGood

customer_reviews.title: Well done, AMD, well done...
customer_reviews.text: Well done, AMD, well done... -Ryzen 5 1600x -GIGABYTE AB350 mobo -Corsair H110i -Corsair RM850x -970TI (next upgrade) -Corsair Vengance 16GB RAM
customer_reviews.author: Samuel F.

customer_reviews.title: Working great after several months
customer_reviews.text: Been using this with an Acer tuff motherboard for 4 months and have no issues playing ARC survival on ultra
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: I got to say this processor is a good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I got to say this processor is a good bang for your buck! Stock cooler works well enough for some light overclocking so don't be scared to give it a little boost.
customer_reviews.author: Devante Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great CPU with no problems installing. A good alternative to an intel i5 7600k
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Happy except...
customer_reviews.text: If not for the RAM compatibility issues plaguing this platform, it'd be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: On 1st Ryzen gen this was the most awesome chip in my opinion price and performance wise.
customer_reviews.author: NHKonta

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I had an A10 processor and built a new pc with this. I'm able to play Fortnite and Modern Warfare with no glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Aflleje

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Decent Price for Gaming Rig.
customer_reviews.text: Four months into putting this chip to work and it is still working as advertised. Can handle Playing PUBG and other AAA games (as long as the rest of your PC can handle it). Getting exactly what I want from it. Didn't get anything higher than 1600X simply because I did not intend on playing 4K games.
customer_reviews.author: Jay A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent processor!
customer_reviews.text: Professor does exactly what I need it to. Haven’t stress tested but have never had an issue. Paired it with a EVGA 1070 TI and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: AMD>Intel
customer_reviews.text: This processor is a beast. Even if it for budget. But the downfall of this processor is that it require a DDR4 ram. Which is pretty expensive these days.
customer_reviews.author: Legacy

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you already have a GPU
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a MSI x370 mobo with a GTX 1060, and it's been running stable for months of frequent usage. It's handled long game sessions, excessive multitasking(far more than the typical person actually uses i.e. dozens of browser tabs, dev tools, background apps, and resource hungry games).
customer_reviews.author: Koby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great chip for the price. Easily overclocked to 4Ghz with no voltage increase. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect price and great processor. Worth every dollar. You want something great, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Thorinox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that this CPU does not have built in video.
customer_reviews.author: C. Krater

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor
customer_reviews.text: So far it has handled everything I have thrown at it without fail and very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wilson

customer_reviews.title: 6 cores of pure bliss
customer_reviews.text: This cpu pairs perfectly with my gtx1080. Handles video editing well and never have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I love these new gen tech
customer_reviews.text: Loving this thing. Built myself a new PC to upgrade from my old HP PC I had. Went from a AMD A10-6700 and there is no comparison here. I love these new gen tech.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Duane

customer_reviews.title: awesome processor
customer_reviews.text: has great price to performance paired with my geforce gtx 1060 6gb
customer_reviews.author: Justin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for gaming system
customer_reviews.text: Working great in a gaming setup. Great performance for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Stable and reliable OC.
customer_reviews.text: Running stable overclocked at 4.1ghz on Asus rog strix b350 gaming motherboard. Runs cool with the cooler I bought. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sarvis

customer_reviews.title: Work good
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my new budget build and gets the job done and then some. Quality at a budget builders price point.
customer_reviews.author: julio

customer_reviews.title: decent but a bit old
customer_reviews.text: this processor was great a few years ago but today it is a litle out dated. you wont find a better 6 core cpu for cheaper but it is a little slow running todays games.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: For the price I would recommend this cpu
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for gaming and medium video editing. The cpu is very fast and I definitely use the 12 thread capabilities when working with videos or rendering. For the price I would recommend this cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Franky J

customer_reviews.title: quality for price has been great. keep scrolling if you want technical jargon
customer_reviews.text: quality for price has been great. keep scrolling if you want technical jargon. It works smoothly in my build.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Need a good heatsink.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as described. Maybe better to buy the latest Ryzen which includes the graphics embedded with the CPU.

customer_reviews.title: ... is a PRICE / PERFORMANCE monster AMD has done great work! 1600x 12 cores and it works great
customer_reviews.text: it is a PRICE / PERFORMANCE monster AMD has done great work! 1600x 12 cores and it works great, he gives his money. I would recommend it to everyone. I hope we use it for many years without problems. thanks AMD ! thanks AMAZON !

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend got this for my build and it’s aMazing for amd ! It’s bank for the buck
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing processor, was able to easily overclock it. Using a closed loop liquid cooler (Corsair)
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Had 3 Bent pins, but bent them back and ...
customer_reviews.text: Had 3 Bent pins, but bent them back and works perfectly. No issues running any games or applications. Haven't seen anything over 70 percent load
customer_reviews.author: philip

customer_reviews.title: Runs great and has fantastic future-proofing.
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU. I mean what else can I say, it has Funtastic multi-core performance, and also the am-4 platform is very future-proofed. I don't think I'm going to need a CPU anytime soon but if I do I would go for the same exact one.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas p.

customer_reviews.title: I love this CPU
customer_reviews.text: I love this CPU. I thought I would need the Ryzen 7, but I am getting the frames, and the performance I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and powerful
customer_reviews.text: New CPU for a new gaming rig. Nice and powerful, and runs very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: BEST GAMING/EDITING/WORK CPU FOR PRICE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Handles anything and everything and can render a HD video at 60fps of the highest quality in a matter of a few minutes. Destroys any game as well from BF1, Escape From Tarkov, Squad, PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds, and many many more. I have ZERO need to even overclock this thing and in demanding online multiplayer games with 60-100 players it's usage maxes out at around 15-30%. Best bang for your buck deal on a cpu in history hands down!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful chip, no included cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great performance chip, mine overclocked to 4.05GHz on all cores paired with a Dark Rock Pro 4 cooler, load temps at 65C.

customer_reviews.text: Perfect RYZEN. With M.2. SSD PCIE Board. 7 second boot up win 10 .

customer_reviews.title: performs good.
customer_reviews.text: It runs hotter than my last cpu but that is normal. performs good.

customer_reviews.title: Amd ryzen is THE best processor to get
customer_reviews.text: Juuust wow. At 100% load this thing only gets to 60° c what an amazing processor

customer_reviews.title: Really good mid range CPU.
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problems with it so far and it's a really nice CPU. Don't cheap out on cooling like I did though. Make sure your case has good air flow and you have a good CPU cooler.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome CPU and very competitive pricing for NZ even when adding shipping and exchange.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing processor for games and VR alike!
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, has held up well over the past year, almost two, and handles VR incredibly well!

customer_reviews.title: Good cpu at good price...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and booted just fine on fresh install, and very quickly at that...

customer_reviews.text: Just installed this in my dad's rig. Upgraded from an FX-8320. This CPU runs great on Linux and gives life to the older GTX 780 he has still.

customer_reviews.title: Keepin it at 30 with a thermaltake cooler runs adobe ...
customer_reviews.text: Keepin it at 30 with a thermaltake cooler runs adobe well pubg with a 1050 to at high at 60fps it's amazing
customer_reviews.author: Jamal Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Runs like a dream. Breezes through most PC games without breaking a sweat.

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a gaming pc, so far the processor is working flawlessly. Not overclocked, running factory settings, but it is doing great ran a benchmark test on it and it did above the midway mark for gaming benchmarks (3D mark). 2/24/19 CPU is still functioning well, son has overclocked it a little played around with the settings some. It is still working well. He plays Fortnite, Battlefront 2, as well as other graphic intensive games and has not complained about the cpu's ability.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU to get, and you can always upgrade later to a 1700x or 1800x.
customer_reviews.author: Witch Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutelly love it, is a beast, recommended, but new ones are comming, still a fantastic choice
customer_reviews.author: walter delgado

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming CPU
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this CPU for my 2nd Gaming PC build and I love it! It's a great gaming CPU for the price. I currently have it overclocked at 4.0 Ghz with no issues whatsoever. Do make sure to get a CPU cooling fan with heatsink - I used the AMD Wraith Max CPU cooling fan and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect out of the Box.
customer_reviews.text: After researching the new Ryzen processors I chose the 1600x as a good mid-range option. I upgraded my system from an i-5 that was still functioning well, but it was approaching the five year mark. This is my first experience with overclocking a processor, and it was tricky in the beginning until I read a great deal on what was necessary. I was able to get the system to run at 4.1 GHZ, but settling in at 4.0 GHZ. I am overjoyed at the performance of this chip, unfortunately there are still some issues with RAM that I hope will soon be corrected through updates. I paired this processor with an ASUS Prime x370-a motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: JByrd71

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great shipped faster than everything else fantastic power in this product.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Good for the value
customer_reviews.text: I like the cpu works great but looks like it was used small scratches maby just manufacture testing
customer_reviews.author: Haidar

customer_reviews.title: ... out for an RMA I have not received a good CPU to date
customer_reviews.text: Update new part arrived and is working perfectly no crashing or other issues what so ever. Thank you AMD Got the package quick and just as quick I had to send this out for an RMA I have not received a good CPU to date. I will update when I get another from AMD. CPU worked but was locking up and going to reboot, "reboot always failed and needed a power cycle down to start"
customer_reviews.author: Ronald N. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great VFM CPU for overclocking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great CPU. I have it overclocked to 3.9GHz pretty effortlessly and at 1.33V so temperatures are very manageable. Single core performance is not great but not bad either, but it has 6 cores/12 threads which is not available with any of intel's offerings in this price range. I'm not going to criticize this for not coming with a CPU cooler as most people getting this type of product are probably using aftermarket coolers anyway and if you're not overclocking it's not a huge investment.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This processor is solid. Installed in my mini-itx build: ASRock gaming itx/ac paired with a GTX 980Ti and G.Skill 16GB 3200mhz RAM and it runs anything I throw at it with ease. I always had intel processors up until now, and I don't regret buying this processor at all. A solid 5/5, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Piccolo

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang For Your Buck CPU!
customer_reviews.text: Great processor! Overclocked to 3.9 ghz no problem. Just make sure you buy a cooler to go with it! Love that it comes with 6 cores!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Parsley

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU at a far better price than the competition
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased multiple Ryzen series processors, and the 1600X is probably the best buy for your money. If you intend to OC sure you may get lucky on a 1600, but the 1600X is binned to a higher standard and thus has less wiggle room. My first 1600 topped out at 3.56, but the base on a 1600X is 3.6 and every one I've picked up was able to hit at least 3.95.
customer_reviews.author: Rezalas

customer_reviews.title: XFR is great, for the way many games are coded
customer_reviews.text: Wish the IPC was higher, or at lease Overclockable past 4.1 with proper cooling. XFR is great, for the way many games are coded. Box was funny. I'd think it'd be better to put the chip in the center of the box, not on the edge where it could be damaged. Anxiously awaiting higher IPC with Ryzen2 this February. Single core performance xfr autoclocks to 4.09ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen
